content.rendered:
Dedicated to Lord Shiva as Kedarnath or the lord of Kedar region, this is one of the most difficult, testing and challenging journey in all of the Char Dham Yatra temples. Located in the district of Rudraprayag and by the holy river of Mandakini that goes on to merge with Alaknanda in Devprayag to form Ganga River, Kedarnath Dham is probably one of the holiest ad the most auspicious temples in India. This highest Lord Shiva Jyotirlinga stands against the majestic backdrop of the snow clad Kedar dome mountain range that only adds on to the serenity of the temple.

When the temple doors open for the yatra Darshan it gets flocked heavily by devotees and shaivites from all over the world. The journey to this remote region on the foothills of Garhwal Himalayas requires the devotees to cover a long and challenging journey on the hills along with a trekking journey of around 18 kms up hill. People choose to go via ponies or palkis and stay in tents near the temple premise. People nowadays not just go to offer their prayer to the lord but also spend some time meditating on the cave which is just 1 km up wards from the temple and enables the occupant to observe some of the most stunning and awe inspiring views of the Kedar Ghati below.

Kedarnath temple has long since been visited by travelers, explorers, saints, sages, seers, adventure enthusiasts and more. Not only is it a part of the holy Char Dham Yatra but is also included in the holy pinch Kedar Yatra that covers all the prominent temples which is believed to have been set up by the Pandava brothers while looking for the lord. The packages we offer are pocket friendly and designed to suit the requirement of each one of our clients no matter where they are coming from.

Kedarnath temple in every sense is a wholesome experience comprising the best of both worlds i.e. spirituality and adventure which creates a lifetime’s worth of memories. What better way of spending your vacation with your family in a holy and religious manner at the abode of the lord himself. The packages also include visit to some of the top sightseeing attractions which dot the region like Janki Chatti, Sonprayag etc. all the regions and places of tourist attraction hold immense significance in the life of every devout Hindu.

The package created by us ensures that you have the time of your life and experience the blessings of the lord and the supreme power above. With the help of expert and skilled team of professionals each of the packages to Kedarnath guarantees a great time which is filled with spirituality, rejuvenation and immense tranquility. Travel with ease, stay in quality accommodations, go sightseeing and excursions and have the best Darshan of the higher power in a place which was once and always will be the spiritual, tranquil and religious Hindu hub of the world.

FAQs for Kedarnath Tour Packages

Q. What Is The Best Time To Visit Kedarnath?

A. The pilgrimage is opened for only 6 months in a year so you will have to decide your Kedarnath Tour Plan according to that. Additionally, we don’t recommend you to plan your travel in the monsoon months as it will be quite challenging to walk on the trekking trails and the steep slopes.

Q. How Do I Plan A Trip To Kedarnath?

A. Pre-planning is must for your travel plans especially if you are visiting places like Kedarnath hence, check out a few customized Kedarnath Holiday Packages and throw all your worries away for the trip. IRCTC Kedarnath Package can also be a nice option if you are looking to reach the distance by train.

Q. How Much Does A Trip To Kedarnath Cost?

A. Below mentioned are few of the most liked Kedarnath Trip Budgets, so check them out and book the best one that suits your budget of Kedarnath Yatra Package cost.

Q. What Is Kedarnath Famous For?

A. Kedarnath is pretty popular for its immense spiritual ambiance, ancient temple, picturesque location, and challenging trekking trail.

Q. What Can I Buy In Kedarnath?

A. Being a spiritual destination, Kedarnath doesn’t offer you many options for shopping but if you are looking for religious items then this is the best place.

Q. What Is Inside Kedarnath Temple?

A. When you enter inside the Kedarnath Temple, you will get to see the five gorgeous statues of the five Pandava brothers, Lord Krishna, Nandi, and most importantly a huge Shivalinga.

Q. What Is The Story Of Kedarnath?

A. According to Hindu mythology, Pandava brothers were burdened with the guilt of doing fratricide and to wash away their sin they decided to please Lord Shiva but the god was in deep anger and didn’t want to forgive them so easily. Hence, he transformed himself into a bull to hide his identity but one of them recognized him and then to get away from his hold Lord Shiva submerged himself into the earth.

Q. Why Kedarnath Temple Closed In Winter?

A. This astonishing Shiva shrine is nestled at an insane location and in winter the region receives heavy snowfall thus the temple is closed in this season.

Q. Can We Visit Kedarnath In Winter?

A. Kedarnath is established on a huge elevation amidst the Himalayas hence, it is not advised to visit Kedarnath in winter as the region receives heavy snowfall. Also, the shrine gets closed with the onset of winter season.

Q. Can We Trek Kedarnath In Night?

A. No, it is not at all a great idea to cover the trekking trails at Kedarnath after it gets dark and if in case you couldn’t start your trek in the afternoon then you are advised to stay at your accommodation for the day.

Q. Can We Go Kedarnath By Car?

A. You cannot go straight to the temple by car as Gaurikund is the last motorable road from Kedarnath. So, if you are planning to reach the destination by car then arrange your parking at Gaurikund.

Q. How Far Is Kedarnath Temple From Helipad?

A. One needs to cover a total distance of 700 meters to reach the Kedarnath Temple from the helipad.

Q. How Can I Go To Kedarnath From Delhi?

A. One needs to cover a total road distance of 453 km to reach Kedarnath from Delhi and the best route to reach the pilgrimage is to catch a bus from Delhi to Dehradun and then for your further journey you can hire a private taxi or a cab.

Note: The travel agencies keep themselves busy in designing several travel plans including Kedarnath Tour Package from Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore, Ahmedabad, Surat, and Jaipur.

Q. How To Plan Kedarnath Badrinath Yatra?

A. Read a few of the well-narrated travel guides related to these holy sites and then plan accordingly.

Q. How Can I Stay In Kedarnath?

A. Finding an accommodation in Kedarnath is not hectic if you go with a proper planning as there are some nice hotels and guesthouses located at a closer distance from the shrine.

Q. Is Permit Required To Visit Kedarnath?

A. Yes, one needs to go through the biometric registration procedure before visiting Kedarnath. The travelers can opt for both either online or offline mode of registration.

Q. How Can I Book Helicopter In Kedarnath?

A. Kedarnath helicopter booking is not a very difficult task as there are travel companies providing several Kedarnath holiday packages and helicopter service is a part.
